page.title: 05Hatfield Broad Oak Manors
page.content: In former times the parish of Hatfield Broad Oak had several manor houses. In the village itself the old high brick wall on the south side of the High Street between the school and Brick House used to enclose the grounds of Hatfield Bury, an ancient manor which was eventually pulled down about 1850. Barrington Hall, which stands in an extensive park to the north of the village partly on the site of the priory, was occupied until 1836 by members of the Barrington family. It then passed to Mr. George Lowndes, who in 1861 gave the land on which the school was built and in 1863 renovated and considerably altered the house. From 1908 until 1976 the Gosling family were in residence but since then the Hall has been used as the offices of a perfume company.
